body:
Try without the storage_url you shouldn't need that. 

If that doesn't work then try the lsd with --dump-bodies and post the output (remove the Authorization lines).

I removed `storage_url` but still does not work. However with `--dump-bodies` looks like it is a problem talking to keystone

```
vpn-ho-d-130:~ proto$ rclone -v --dump-bodies lsd lsswift:/
2016/04/28 20:51:19 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2016/04/28 20:51:19 HTTP REQUEST
2016/04/28 20:51:19 POST /v2.0/tokens HTTP/1.1
Host: keystone.cloud.switch.ch:5000
User-Agent: rclone/v1.29
Content-Length: 91
Content-Type: application/json
Accept-Encoding: gzip

{"auth":{"passwordCredentials":{"username":"saverio.proto@switch.ch","password":"secret"}}}
2016/04/28 20:51:19 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2016/04/28 20:51:19 <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2016/04/28 20:51:19 HTTP RESPONSE
2016/04/28 20:51:19 HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
Content-Length: 114
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Type: application/json
Date: Thu, 28 Apr 2016 18:51:20 GMT
Server: nginx
Vary: X-Auth-Token
Www-Authenticate: Keystone uri="https://keystone.cloud.switch.ch:5000"
X-Distribution: Ubuntu
X-Openstack-Request-Id: req-aa3acd86-e927-42c0-b1be-0b2a51f80adf

{"error": {"message": "The request you have made requires authentication.", "code": 401, "title": "Unauthorized"}}
2016/04/28 20:51:19 <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2016/04/28 20:51:19 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2016/04/28 20:51:19 HTTP REQUEST
2016/04/28 20:51:19 POST /v2.0/tokens HTTP/1.1
Host: keystone.cloud.switch.ch:5000
User-Agent: rclone/v1.29
Content-Length: 97
Content-Type: application/json
Accept-Encoding: gzip

{"auth":{"RAX-KSKEY:apiKeyCredentials":{"username":"saverio.proto@switch.ch","apiKey":"secret"}}}
2016/04/28 20:51:19 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2016/04/28 20:51:20 <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2016/04/28 20:51:20 HTTP RESPONSE
2016/04/28 20:51:20 HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Content-Length: 246
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Type: application/json
Date: Thu, 28 Apr 2016 18:51:20 GMT
Server: nginx
Vary: X-Auth-Token
X-Distribution: Ubuntu
X-Openstack-Request-Id: req-2a361d82-e212-4cbd-afde-c62cd293d5a9

{"error": {"message": "Expecting to find passwordCredentials in auth - the server could not comply with the request since it is either malformed or otherwise incorrect. The client is assumed to be in error.", "code": 400, "title": "Bad Request"}}
2016/04/28 20:51:20 <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2016/04/28 20:51:20 Failed to create file system for "lsswift:/": Bad Request
```

Is it possible you got your username or password wrong? That is what is looks like. The second attempt tries to log in the racks pace way which fails too. 

Has your password got any funny characters in? (non alphabetic?) 

Can you log in with a different tool (eg the openstack swift client?)

Hello,
the password has no special characters. However you were right ! I typed the wrong password :+1: 
Now it still does not work but with a different error:

```
rclone -v lsd --dump-bodies lsswift:
2016/04/28 22:30:26 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2016/04/28 22:30:26 HTTP REQUEST
2016/04/28 22:30:26 POST /v2.0/tokens HTTP/1.1
Host: keystone.cloud.switch.ch:5000
User-Agent: rclone/v1.29
Content-Length: 95
Content-Type: application/json
Accept-Encoding: gzip

{"auth":{"passwordCredentials":{"username":"saverio.proto@switch.ch","password":"secret"}}}
2016/04/28 22:30:26 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2016/04/28 22:30:27 <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2016/04/28 22:30:27 HTTP RESPONSE
2016/04/28 22:30:27 HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Length: 406
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Type: application/json
Date: Thu, 28 Apr 2016 20:30:27 GMT
Server: nginx
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubdomains
Vary: X-Auth-Token
X-Distribution: Ubuntu
X-Openstack-Request-Id: req-f8cf78ad-b2c4-471f-b182-2a9b30a18781

{"access": {"token": {"issued_at": "2016-04-28T20:30:27.191649", "expires": "2016-04-28T21:30:27Z", "id": "secrettoken", "audit_ids": ["secret"]}, "serviceCatalog": [], "user": {"username": "saverio.proto@switch.ch", "roles_links": [], "id": "870aab4e3af6441b8b5ebfb0dcaa8412", "roles": [], "name": "saverio.proto@switch.ch"}, "metadata": {"is_admin": 0, "roles": []}}}
2016/04/28 22:30:27 <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2016/04/28 22:30:27 Failed to create file system for "lsswift:": Response didn't have storage url and auth token
```

I tried both with and without the following line in the conf file:
`
storage_url = https://os.unil.cloud.switch.ch/swift/v1
`

My keystone catalog has the following entry:

```
Service: object-store
+-------------+------------------------------------------+
|   Property  |                  Value                   |
+-------------+------------------------------------------+
|   adminURL  | https://os.unil.cloud.switch.ch/swift/v1 |
|      id     |     191be5f7b7f64277b6ab1e9a6564e0c3     |
| internalURL | https://os.unil.cloud.switch.ch/swift/v1 |
|  publicURL  | https://os.unil.cloud.switch.ch/swift/v1 |
|    region   |                    LS                    |
+-------------+------------------------------------------+
```

The swift openstack client works fine, so I assume the entries published in the keystone catalog to be correct.
@ncw what version of Keystone are you running ? could be a problem with keystone on my side ?

I'm not sure what keystone version that is, but you should get the endpoints returned from a correctly configured keystone.  That is why I guess you've had to specify the storage_url to the openstack swift client - you shouldn't have to do that - it should read it from the service catalog.

So I would guess it is a problem with keystone config

One thing to try would be to put the region in the rclone config..

I fixed it ! It is a know issue in keystone:
https://answers.launchpad.net/keystone/+question/192094

If you dont specify your tenant you get a empty service catalog.

I had to add only my tenant name (in my case it is the same as the user name).
in `rclone.conf` I added the line

```
tenant = saverio.proto@switch.ch
```

and now it works. Thank you.

Great - well done! 

Does that work without the storage url now?

Yes it works without storage url.
It is the tenant option that is really mandatory
I've written some more docs about these errors see commit below!

issue.title: SWIFT tenant option is mandatory but interactive config session say optional

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
When filing an issue, please include the following information if
possible as well as a description of the problem.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.29

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Mac OS X 64bit

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Swift

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone config

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

During the interactive setup of the remote we have

```
Tenant name - optional
```

But from issue #460 we know that the Tenant is mandatory for the swift remote to make authentication properly working.
